column4: I'm trying to update using apt-get dist-upgrade, but I keep getting this:  "The following packages have been kept back:  gaim gimp mozilla-firefox mozilla-firefox-gnome-support smbclient" does anyone know wju?
i would think that you have "backports" enabled that make it clash. try to comment it out before installing.
something you put into sources.list also have the package you are trying to install. there are now conflicts in your repos. the same packages exist on several servers.
I see...so how do I disable these backports?
first - try to put a # infront of the lines you added, then do a 'sudo apt-get update'
if I comment out the backports, the upgrades can't be found at all
ahh sounds good, I wish I had some :)
well, I used the ubuntu updates. and it said "gaim, gimp, mozilla-firefox, mozilla-firefox-gnome-support and smbclient" were held back and I had to use apt0get dist-upgrade to update those
if you really want those update, maybe you can force them with the -f option. not sure if thats advisable though since they are in conflict with other versions....
k, I don't want to risk that,  thanks
